definitions.definition: in the company or presence of somebody/something

examples.text: She lives with her parents.
I have a client with me right now.
a nice steak with a bottle of red wine

definitions.definition: having or carrying something

examples.text: a girl with *(= who has)* red hair
a jacket with a hood
He looked at her with a hurt expression.
They're both in bed with flu.
a man with a suitcase

definitions.definition: using something

examples.text: Cut it with a knife.
It is treated with acid before being analysed.

definitions.definition: used to say what fills, covers, etc. something

examples.text: The bag was stuffed with dirty clothes.
Sprinkle the dish with salt.

definitions.definition: in opposition to somebody/something; against somebody/something

examples.text: to fight with somebody
to play tennis with somebody
at war with a neighbouring country
I had an argument with my boss.

definitions.definition: in connection with; in the case of

examples.text: Be careful with the glasses.
Are you pleased with the result?
Don't be angry with her.
With these students it's pronunciation that's the problem.

definitions.definition: used to show the way in which somebody does something

examples.text: He behaved with great dignity.
She sleeps with the window open.
Don't stand with your hands in your pockets.

definitions.definition: used when considering one fact in relation to another

examples.text: She won't be able to help us with all the family commitments she has.
It's much easier compared with last time.

definitions.definition: including

examples.text: The meal with wine came to $20 each.
With all the lesson preparation I have to do I work 12 hours a day.

definitions.definition: used to show who has possession of or responsibility for something

examples.text: The keys are with reception.
Leave it with me.

definitions.definition: employed by; using the services of

examples.text: She acted with a touring company for three years.
I bank with HSBC.

definitions.definition: because of; as a result of

examples.text: She blushed with embarrassment.
His fingers were numb with cold.

definitions.definition: because of something and as it happens

examples.text: The shadows lengthened with the approach of sunset.
Skill comes with practice.

definitions.definition: in the same direction as something

examples.text: Marine mammals generally swim with the current.

definitions.definition: showing that something/somebody has been separated from something/somebody

examples.text: I could never part with this ring.
Can we dispense with the formalities?

definitions.definition: despite something

examples.text: With all her faults I still love her.

definitions.definition: used in exclamations

examples.text: Off to bed with you!
Down with school!

definitions.definition: to support somebody and agree with what they say

examples.text: We're all with you on this one.

definitions.definition: to be able to understand what somebody is talking about

examples.text: Are you with me?
I'm afraid I'm not quite with you.

definitions.definition: understanding what is happening around you

examples.text: You don't seem very with it today.

definitions.definition: knowing about current fashions and ideas

examples.text: Don't you have anything more with it to wear?

definitions.definition: straight after that; then

examples.text: He muttered a few words of apology and with that he left.

wordOrigin: Old English, probably a shortening of a Germanic preposition related to obsolete English wither ‘adverse, opposite’.
